results.title: On the job
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee these seven films are designed to encourage aboriginal job seekers and illustrate some of the employment opportunities available.

results.title: We did it!: Rockhampton and Mackay
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight, Film Australia and National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”
Shows Aboriginal people at work in Rockhampton and Mackay, talking about how they got their jobs, what they like about them and giving tips for other job seekers. Includes an employment officer, a secretary, an apprentice picutre framer and a TAFE field officer.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: We did it!: Western Australia
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight, Film Australia and National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
Shows Aboriginal people in Western Australia talking about how they got their jobs, what they like about them and giving tips for other job seekers. Includes a student enrolled nurse, a teacher’s aide, a beautician, a horticulturalist and a park ranger.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: We did it!: South Australia
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight, Film Australia and National Aboriginal Employment Development Committee
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
Shows Aboriginal people at work in South Australia, talking about how they got their jobs, what they like about them and giving tips for other job seekers. Includes a fisheries officer, an apprentice diesel mechanic, a nurse, a carpenter and a teacher.
Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Women of Utopia
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
With jokes and good humour, the Aboriginal women of Utopia cattle station show how they make their beautiful and exotic batik fabrics. Some of the women featured are Emily Ngwarai, Gloria Pitjara, Rosie Kunoth and Myrtle Pitjara. Also shows gathering/hunting of food and the cooking of it. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: A Ticket to ride
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “On the job (A)”.
Explores the lives of four Aboriginal people, two women and two men, who have battled to attain high career achievements and top jobs in Australia. Features Wesley Lanhupuy, MLA Arnhem Land, N.T., Pat O’Shane, Secretary of N.S.W. Ministry of Aboriginal Affairs, Ernie Bridge, MLA Kimberley, W.A. and Marcia Langton, BA, 1st Class Hons, ANU.

results.title: Expansion of metals
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Physics in action”.
Covers the expansion of a wire due to increase in heat from electric current: determination of the coefficient of expansion of brass; application of expansion in rails; building constructions and bridges; shrink fitting and expansion fitting of metal couplings. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Laws of motion
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Physics in action”.
Uses laboratory demonstrations and experiments to demonstrate elastic collisions, the principle of conservation of momentum, Newton’s second law of motion, constant force and constant acceleration and the law of falling bodies.
